result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Count two.
Count one.

Defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams in court with attorney Megan L. Morrisey.  Megan M. Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Sentencing proceeds.   Statements by counsel and defendant.

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 9 months at the House of Correction - concurrent; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 12-1-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms, he must provide a DNA sample if not previously provided and pay the DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 2 years  - concurrent -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT - 1 year  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION - 1 year; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by the end of the sentence or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.  

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  1) no violations of criminal law rising to the level of probable cause; 2) pay any monetary amounts ordered but not paid while in the institution; 3) AODA, programs or treatment as recommended; 4) no illegally controlled substances; 5) random screening; 6) obtain GED.

Court finds defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge - if not already done
-  DOC to collect those monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Count 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1 & 2 as charged in the Complaint and enters a judgment of conviction.

On motion of the State, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED and read-in for sentencing purposes. 

Parties advised the Court will listen to statements by counsel, victim, a friend or relative of the defendant and defendant.  Any other statements must be in writing and provided to the Court 72 hours in advance of sentencing.  There is a possibility of incarceration, if so, defendant should be prepared to start serving the sentence at the next date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  William Levins for Megan Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defense asks to have a misdemeanor case transferred from Br. 17 for global resolution.  Court allows the transfer.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Randy Sitzberger for Megan M Williamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. J.D. Watts, Br. 15, for review. crt
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-21-2014 at 01:30 pm.

As an additional condition of bail:
No guns
No weapons
No drugs without a valid prescription

Court ordered defendant to report for booking and release no later than 3:00 p.m. on 04-12-2014.

Defendant Lawrence Jerom Adams in court with attorney Megan L Morrisey.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #14-071

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Konkol, Branch 44. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
As to Counts 1 and 3:
Defendant entered a plea of Not Guilty.

Court orders case adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
